metadata.titel_preek: A Word To Young Preachers On The Name Of The Savior

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The revelation and proclamation of the dual nature of Jesus Christ (Jesus/Christ) as the source of empowerment for the preacher and hope for the world.

tekstueel_bewijs: we all wonder about how empowered we are or are going to be to proclaim the Word
it is the agony and the ecstasy of our calling to try [to exhaust the meaning of his name]
touch the outer edge of the garment of his greatness
to make that title, Jesus Christ, clear

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Biblical Tradition
tekstueel_bewijs: God has given him a name which is highly exalted
The New Testament seeks again and again to assert that

ontvanger.identificatie: The World / The Young Preachers / The Suffering (India)
tekstueel_bewijs: give to all of these who have gathered here a good day and a good work
to them he gave power to become the sons of God
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Church History (Spurgeon/Grandfather)
tekstueel_bewijs: deeply touched by the Spirit of the Lord
the saints who from their labors rest
helper.rol_van_god: God is both the Object of study and the Sender of the mandate.

tekstueel_bewijs: beyond the power of any creature... ever to exhaust
the evil of racism in his own people
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is the 'gone wrongness' of the world and the inherent inability of human reason to grasp the mystery of the Incarnation.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Ethical application: The church acting 'under the cross' to solve social/physical needs.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Indian Christians / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Social justice and relief (clean water, rope making)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical action in India is presented as a direct result of 'finding his name precious'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: thou, through him, hast given us that great and rich privilege
the Lord gives and takes away
he gave power to become the sons of God
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we may ever be mindful of our unworthiness
I did not accept that. I did not surrender to that

voorbeelden: His people ought to revere and adore
willing to confront and to acknowledge
to make that title, Jesus Christ, clear
we will only then begin to understand
he gave power to become the sons of God
how empowered we are or are going to be

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'knowing' and 'pondering' of the mystery as the primary task of the preacher.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'earthy' Jesus (S1) to the 'divine' Christ (S2), then synthesizes them in the 'God-man' (Resolution).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through the Chalcedonian logic of 'very man' and 'very God' co-existing.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the divinity of Christ is treated as a 'grand and creative torture' for the mind.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While there are moral imperatives for preachers, the engine of the sermon is the objective reality of Christ's person and God's initiative in the Incarnation.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: born, not of blood... but of God
to them he gave power to become the sons of God

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Spurgeon and his grandfather are used as models of humility and focus for the young preacher.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The focus remains on the 'Gospel' they preach rather than their own skill.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: The preacher is the active subject who must 'ponder' and 'proclaim'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the theological mystery of the Name to the practical mission in India is highly coherent.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'saved by grace' and 'seeking to become worthy'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: of his fullness have all we received, and grace for grace

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment ('gifts and endowments which belong... to the various stages')

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is structurally sound, placing Christ as the Object of desire and God as the Sender. The preacher is the Subject, but one who is 'empowered' by the Object.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer is often the subject of 'seeking' and 'becoming worthy'.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that 'becoming worthy' is a fruit of the Spirit's work, not a prerequisite.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Shift from 'we must ponder' to 'the Spirit reveals'.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already takes the opponent seriously.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (The Name) → Ethics (The Cross in India).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful blend of high Christology and practical mission, avoiding the trap of moralism by grounding all action in the objective reality of the Incarnation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the Spurgeon anecdote; semiotics focuses on how that anecdote establishes the 'Gospel' as the Sender of the preacher's mandate.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would explain John 1; semiotics explains how John 1 functions as the 'Axis of Transmission' for the preacher's authority.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Name' is not just a word, but an Actant (Object) that provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' (Power) to the Subject (Preacher).

appendices.notities: The sermon maintains a high 'Rutledge Score' by consistently making Christ the subject of the saving and transformative actions in the India illustration.
